sources.data_found: The Dartmouth Discovery cluster is a high-performance computing (HPC) system running on Linux RHEL8 comprised of ~130 compute nodes with over 6,000 CPU cores, 120,000 GPU cores, more than 12 TB of memory, and approximately 3.2 PB of storage.

Discovery infrastructure has undergone a substantial expansion, now comprising over 6,000 computational cores. This system is further bolstered by an array of GPU nodes that incorporate 10 A100 GPUs, 72 A5500 GPUs, and 12 V100 GPUs.

GPU compute nodes available: gpuq – High-end compute nodes with A100 GPUs in MIG with 40GB slices (free members); a100 – High-end GPU nodes with A100 GPUs – Paid tier; v100_preemptable – High-end compute nodes with v100 GPUs; a5000 – Mid-range GPU nodes; a5500 – Mid-range GPU nodes; adanova01 – High-end GPU nodes.
For GPU shares we have V100s ($2,500/year) and A100s ($3,500/year). Discovery has been running since the fall of 2005 and currently contains over 4000 cores for jobs.

In 2023, the most popular Bachelors Degree concentrations at Dartmouth College were Econometrics & Quantitative Economics (196 degrees awarded), General Political Science & Government (182 degrees), and Computer Science (136 degrees).

student_data.notes: Undergraduate CS count estimated from: 136 CS bachelor's degrees awarded in 2023 (DataUSA) × 4 years in program = 544 undergraduate CS majors. MS CS count estimated using national average MS completion time of 2 years and approximately 32-33 MS degrees per year = 65. PhD CS count estimated using typical 5-year time-to-degree and approximately 10 PhD completions per year = 50. Total CS students = 544 + 65 + 50 = 659.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Mid-range GPU nodes mentioned in Discovery cluster overview.
a5000 partition mentioned in cluster details but exact count not specified.

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS INCLUDED + CALCULATIONS

Dartmouth Discovery HPC Cluster:
- 10 A100 GPUs (explicitly stated; using MIG with 40GB slices suggests A100 40GB models)
- 12 V100 GPUs (explicitly stated)
- 72 A5500 GPUs (explicitly stated)
- Additional GPU types mentioned in partitions (a5000, adanova01) but specific counts not provided

Total enumerated high-end GPUs = 10 A100 + 12 V100 = 22 GPUs
Total mid-range GPUs = 72 A5500 GPUs

Note: The cluster claims '120,000 GPU cores' but this appears to include the A5500 and other mid-range GPUs. The exact inventory of all GPU models is not fully disclosed. Investment options mention V100s ($2,500/year) and A100s ($3,500/year) for paid tier access.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach. GPU data shows Dartmouth has a modest GPU infrastructure focused on A100 40GB and V100 models, with significant investment in mid-range A5500 GPUs. Student counts estimated from degree completion data as direct enrollment figures by major were not available.
